content.description: Find the very obvious feature and start on the right-most side of the ledgey hand feature. Traverse left until it's possible to top out. Really cool and fun feature.
content.protection: Single pad, spotter to move is preferable.
content.location: Just left of the Rustic Remnants boulder, the unmistakable shark in the wall.

content.description:
A fine route with a tough move through a sloping pocket/edge, and a sloping top-out on wavy schist. Start on the diamond-shaped gap (the missing piece should be around somewhere....), and pull out left to the sloping pocket. It looks easier to go right, but it's not, somehow...

vimeo.com/93535717

  It's the last problem shown in this video (and the displayed picture).
content.location: Hike up into the corridor until you see this clean, rounded block sitting on your left, probably 200 yards from the start of the corridor.

content.description:
(It's what I was subsisting on at the time of the FA) 

  Start on the flat, sloping shelf just right of Rustic Remnants. Pull straight up until it's possible to move left to top out.
content.location: In the Upper Corridor, on the same boulder as Rustic Remnants.

content.description: Start on a small right crimp and good left hand on the arete. Pull towards the top, several ways are possible, but the most direct/interesting falls in the V2 range. Pull the sloping mantle for the full "beached whale" value!
content.location: On the same boulder as Rustic Remnants, in the Upper Corridor. Just left of it.

content.description:
One of the shorter approaches, though not exactly on the trail. 

  A corridor of rock with schist on both sides, with most of the climbing is on the left side. This holds one of the highest quality lines in the area, Rustic Remnants (V5). 

  Relatively shady, but don't be afraid to come here when it's cold. Much of the cleaning and climbing here was done with some Spring snow still on the ground.
